column5: Bob thank you for telling me about this site.  I found my nitch here.  I'm a Minnow.  When are you talking to Hoggie on the radio.  It cas e other people didn't know  Bob is doing a radio interview with hoggie on Catch-n-radio.  Again thanks.  Bob

For those who don't know Robert "Bob" Brunner you are missing a pioneer in the fishing industry. If he were Canadian he would be "Red Fisher". At 82 yrs young Bob is still guide on the US side of Lake St. Clair. Casting on Lake St. Clair no less. He has been inducted into the Fresh Water Hall of Fame and one great guy with a sense of humour. I am pleased to know this man and hope to share a boat with him this yr.  Glad to have you on board OFC,
Bye the way thank you for the kind words.  We will get out this year.  I want to show you Tennessee Sue.

Welcome aboard Bob I also fish StClair and want to find some casting spots on the CDN side here. It's nice to see our group growing with more seasoned muskie hunters. maybe we will see ya out on the water sometime.  Mike
Welcome to the zoo Bob, hope you enjoy your stay, and I'll be looking forward to your stories...uh, I mean reports  Maureen
Motv8tr.  At my age they are reports not stories. LOL

I will give you one good spot Mreh.  Try casting the hump.  Here is another one.  Both sides of the mouth of the Belle in 5 to 10 foot of water wherever you find weeds.  If it is quiet use a surface bait and hang on.  Good Fishing.  Bob
